column3: in which steam is caused to circulate for the purpose of raising the solution of the desired temperature

column5: and maintains an equal pressure within the whole apparatus. The arrangement is shown clearly. Within the boiler is placed the receiver
column9: leaving an annular space between it and the boiler; this space is filled with water. The receiver is furnished with a series of pipes
column10: in which steam or hot water circulates
column11: to heat the charge to the desired temperature. These pipes may be arranged either in coils or vertically. The latter are provided with inner return pipes
column12: so that any condensed water accumulating at the bottom may be forced up the inner pipes by the steam pressure and escape at the top.
